testSteps.description: We need to check how intuitive the send message button is

assertions.text: We need to check how intuitive the entire process to use whatsapp is. Where the user is trying to search for a contact and type a message in the chat to send it. Does it feel natural and easy to use?

evidence.description: Search/filter modal opens immediately when accessed, displaying clear category options and search bar with 'Ask Meta AI or Search' placeholder - indicates easily discoverable search functionality
Search bar shows typed text 'Me' with keyboard auto-suggestions visible - standard, expected text input behavior
Search results appear promptly under 'Chats' heading with 'Me' conversation displayed at top - fast, relevant search results indicating responsive system
Single tap on 'Me' conversation transitions smoothly to chat thread view showing conversation history - direct, predictable navigation
User begins typing 'Hello' in message field with keyboard responding normally - standard message composition starts without issues
Message shows 'Hello test message' with green send button visible and enabled on right - clear affordance for sending message
Message sent successfully, appearing in green bubble with timestamp 11:10 PM and single checkmark, input field clears - immediate, clear feedback of successful send action
Double checkmarks appear indicating message delivered - progressive status updates provide clear communication state
Back navigation returns to Chats list with 'Me' conversation showing latest message preview 'You: Hello test message!' at 11:10 PM - confirms message persistence and proper list update

assertions.explanation: The video demonstrates a natural and intuitive user flow for searching a contact and sending a message. Key positive observations: (1) Search functionality is easily accessible from the main Chats screen with clear filter modal appearing at 0.8s, (2) Typing 'Me' in the search bar immediately produces relevant results at 3.1s with the contact displayed prominently, (3) Tapping the contact at 4.0s smoothly transitions to the chat thread, (4) Message composition from 5.5s to 9.4s shows standard keyboard interaction with auto-suggestions and a clearly visible green send button, (5) Message sends successfully at 11.8s with immediate visual feedback (green bubble, timestamp, checkmark), (6) Delivery status updates naturally at 12.7s with double checkmarks, (7) Navigation back to chat list at 14.2s shows the sent message preview correctly. The process follows expected mobile messaging patterns with no apparent confusion, delays, or error states. Minor uncertainty exists because subjective 'intuitiveness' cannot be fully objectively measured from video observation alone, but all observable interactions suggest smooth, predictable behavior consistent with standard messaging UX patterns.
